abstract: Chief executives of HSBC and Royal Bank of Scotland, which gave an update of its first-quarter performance Friday, said that even though the British economy started to recover in the first quarter, threats to earnings from Europe remained.
snippet: Chief executives of HSBC and Royal Bank of Scotland, which gave an update of its first-quarter performance Friday, said that even though the British economy started to recover in the first quarter, threats to earnings from Europe remained.
lead_paragraph: Two British banking chiefs said Friday that they were closely monitoring the impact of the Greek credit crisis on their businesses, Julia Werdigier reports in The New York Times.

headline.main: HSBC and RBS Watching Books as Greece Shakes
